== Getting the return code from a webpage HTML return codes are standardized codes which a web server returns if a certain situation has occurred. For example the return code "200" means the HTML request is ok and the server will perform the require action, e.g. serving the webpage.
The following code will access web page and print the return code for the HTML access.
The most important HTML return codes are:
Return Code Explaination
200 Ok
301 Permanent redirect to another webpage
400 Bad request
404 Not found
